intro: Hereroa odorata, commonly known as the sweet-scented orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), helping it retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers emit a sweet, intoxicating aroma, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
